title: Give Kkoma his Teemo skin
body: The man has led his team to 3 world championships and 2 of them were consecutive, the coach is just as important as the players and they deserve skins as well. Yeah teemo just got a new skin but this man alongside skt has put his heart and soul into League of legends and he deserves a skin more than anyone

I have to disagree.

Not devaluing his contributing to the team, but the championship skins are something which identifies with the player, this is why you can't give faker ahri for example, he didn't play her at worlds at all(it was an option in s3, but that's not the point).

In other words for a player to get a skin he has to have a notable connection with the champion, so that people to some extent identify that champion with them, unfortunately the coach doesn't play, so I think giving him a skin would go against the symbolism of championship skins.

that shouldn't matter, Easyhoon getting a skin was great because Riot recognized even the little guys, he only played 2 games, one in groups and one in the semifinals but the coach has lead them through EVERY SINGLE GAME. You hear of the Vince Lombardi award in football for him being such a great coach and leading his team to multiple championships, kkoma has done the same for the esports world and the least we can do is get him a skin

> [{quoted}](name=Leo1024,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=Gx3I4xJE,comment-id=000e0000,timestamp=2016-10-31T20:59:50.635+0000)
>
> that shouldn't matter,

Of course it should, the skins signify the victory of that team, and the champions which are associated with that victory, giving a skin to someone who didn't play breaks that tradition, when you look at past skins and splash you see "these champions signify the victory of team A in time B", you give the coach a skin cause he likes teemo, why not give faker an ahri skin? why not give wolf a vayne skin? Why not give duke a shaco skin?
The skins stand for something, and they will stop doing that if you give the coach a skin, unless maybe it was  something genius he drafted, I guess you can give him a nidalee skin then(even though it's the opposite, at least it's something he is related to in some way).

>Easyhoon getting a skin was great because Riot recognized even the little guys, he only played 2 games, one in groups and one in the semifinals but the coach has lead them through EVERY SINGLE GAME.

But Easyhoon actually played a champion, he has also been with them before that, and azir was something he was somewhat known for, it doesn't break the tradition of the previous skins, giving the coach a skin does. 

>You hear of the Vince Lombardi award in football for him being such a great coach and leading his team to multiple championships, kkoma has done the same for the esports world and the least we can do is get him a skin

I don't mind him getting an award, I don't care if they would put a gigantic picture of him on the splash or something, or say something like a ward skin, but the champion skins are something representing the victory of the players and the champions they won on, giving one to the coach ruins that connection.
